verbose_text: Significant suppression of STAT1 phosphorylation at Tyr701 was responsible for Type I IFN antagonism of JEV NS5 proteins, in agreement with prior studies : WNV and TBEV NS5 proteins suppressing tyrosine phosphorylation of STAT1 and DEN NS5 protein suppressing tyrosine phosphorylation of STAT2, blocking formation of STAT1 / STAT1 homo- or heterodimers in Type I IFN induced JAK / STAT signaling pathway 8, 10, 11, 12, 13, 35.
